column3: Our compile tooling will notice that only test files have been modified and thus `make` will only compile the test files if they have been modified, so the wording as in master sounds correct to me.

I'm just confused because it says, "If you modify a **non-test** file, use `make -C src/test` to recompile only what's needed to run the bitcoind tests."\n\nWouldn't that only compile **test** files?
@JBaczuk And all core files needed to run those tests. Make reasons about dependencies.\n\nBut it won't bother building the `bitcoind` binary, which isn't needed for the unit tests.
@sipa Ah, ok, sounds like I'm mistaken, then, thanks.
